segment.source: Optimizing Windows Devices for Multimedia Experiences
segment.target: Optimizing Windows Devices for Multimedia Experiences

segment.source: Customers expect a smooth and glitch free experience when they stream movies, listen to music, video conference with Skype, and create media content.
segment.target: Customers expect a smooth and glitch free experience when they stream movies, listen to music, video conference with Skype, and create media content.

segment.source: Optimizing Windows Devices for Multimedia Experiences
segment.target: Optimizing Windows Devices for Multimedia Experiences

segment.source: Customers expect a smooth and glitch free experience when they stream movies, listen to music, video conference with Skype, and create media content.
segment.target: Customers expect a smooth and glitch free experience when they stream movies, listen to music, video conference with Skype, and create media content.

segment.source: This lab provides an introduction to Media eXperience Analyzer (MXA), a visual performance analysis tool that enables engineers to validate and optimize quality, performance, and latency for media scenarios.
segment.target: This lab provides an introduction to Media eXperience Analyzer (MXA), a visual performance analysis tool that enables engineers to validate and optimize quality, performance, and latency for media scenarios.

segment.source: This hands-on lab also covers the following topics:
segment.target: This hands-on lab also covers the following topics:

segment.source: Assessing audio latency performance and quality for communications scenarios.
segment.target: Assessing audio latency performance and quality for communications scenarios.

segment.source: Analyzing audio glitches and verifying audio is offloaded using MXA.
segment.target: Analyzing audio glitches and verifying audio is offloaded using MXA.

segment.source: Collecting Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) logs for Media Scenarios using Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).
segment.target: Collecting Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) logs for Media Scenarios using Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).

segment.source: This guide introduces the low latency audio communications and low latency audio glitch tests.
segment.target: This guide introduces the low latency audio communications and low latency audio glitch tests.

segment.source: By the end of this guide, you will have a better understanding of how the MXA visualizing tool can be used to analyze ETW logs and identify opportunities to improve multimedia experiences on Windows devices.
segment.target: By the end of this guide, you will have a better understanding of how the MXA visualizing tool can be used to analyze ETW logs and identify opportunities to improve multimedia experiences on Windows devices.

segment.source: This guide consists of the following exercises.
segment.target: This guide consists of the following exercises.

segment.source: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios

segment.source: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR

segment.source: Exercise 3 - Use MXA to Verify that Audio is Offloaded During Full Screen Video Playback
segment.target: Exercise 3 - Use MXA to Verify that Audio is Offloaded During Full Screen Video Playback

segment.source: Exercise 4 - Use MXA to Analyze Audio Glitches
segment.target: Exercise 4 - Use MXA to Analyze Audio Glitches
